s1.title: System Requirements
s1.p: Cocoon requires the following systems to be already installed in your system:

ul.li: Java Virtual Machine A Java 1.2 or later compatible virtual machine must be present for both command line and servlet type usage of Cocoon. Note that all servlet engines require a JVM to run so if you are already using servlets you already have one installed.

Servlet Engine A Servlet 2.2 compliant servlet engine must be present in order to support servlet operation and dynamic request handling. Note that this requirement is optional for command line operation.

s1.title: Installing Cocoon2 on Apache Tomcat (standalone only)
s1.p: Look into the INSTALL document for now (more docs in preparation)

ol.li: In "Authentication:" choose ""passwd" file on the cvs server";
When asked for the password: anwer "anoncvs" (without quotes);
Module name and path on the server is "xml-cocoon" (no quotes);
Choose a dir to put the source code in;
In the text-box behind that: "xml-cocoon2" (without quotes)
If everything goes well, messages will start to appear in the log window;
Wait until you see "*****CVS exited normally with code 0*****" in the log window;
The Cocoon2 source is now on your HD;
Refer to the INSTALL file in the cocoon-dir to create and install the cocoon.war file.
